content.text:
# 2004 Country Music Association Awards

The 2004 Country Music Association Awards, 38th Ceremony, on November 9, 2004, hosted by CMA Award Winning duo, Brooks & Dunn. This was the final ceremony to be held in the Grand Ole Opry House in Nashville, Tennessee.
Winners and Nominees
{| class="wikitable"
! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Entertainer of the Year
! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Album of the Year
|-
| valign="top" |
* Kenny Chesney
** Brooks & Dunn
** Alan Jackson
** Toby Keith
** Tim McGraw
| valign="top" |
* 'When The Sun Goes Down – Kenny Chesney'
** Here For The Party – Gretchen Wilson
** Mud On The Tires – Brad Paisley
** Red Dirt Road – Brooks & Dunn
** Shock’N Y’All – Toby Keith
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Male Vocalist of the Year
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Female Vocalist of the Year

| valign="top" |

| valign="top" |

** “How—s The World Treating You” — James Taylor and Alison Krauss

Performances
Source:
* Alan Jackson and Patty Loveless — "Monday Morning Church"
